name: find-it-faster
description: Find it, but faster! Leveraging fzf and rg.

find-it-faster.general.useGitIgnoreExclu.markdownDescription: Use `.gitignore` entries (if present) to limit search paths

find-it-faster.general.useWorkspaceSearc.markdownDescription: In order to speed up VS Code's native search functionality, you can use the `search.exclude` setting. If checked, this extension will honor the same exclude patterns (as long as they follow the standard "gitignore glob style" that `rg` uses.

find-it-faster.general.additionalSearchL.markdownDescription: When to search the files listed in `general.searchLocations`
enumDescriptions: Never search these locations (setting useful for individual workspace overrides)
Only when no workspace is open

find-it-faster.general.searchWorkspaceFo.markdownDescription: Search the folders defined in the workspace

enumDescriptions: Only search the working directory when no workspace is open

find-it-faster.general.batTheme.markdownDescription: The color theme to use for `bat` (see `bat --list-themes`)

find-it-faster.general.openFileInPreview.markdownDescription: When set to `true` files open in a Preview Editor. Use in conjunction with the `workbench.editor.enablePreivew` setting.

find-it-faster.findFiles.showPreview.markdownDescription: Show a preview window when searching files

find-it-faster.findFiles.previewCommand.markdownDescription: When populated: Used by `fzf` to produce the preview. Use `{}` to indicate the filename. Example: `bat {}`.

find-it-faster.findFiles.previewWindowCo.markdownDescription: When populated: Used by `fzf` to determine position and look of the preview window. See the `fzf` documentation. Example for a horizontal split: `top,50%`.

find-it-faster.findWithinFiles.showPrevi.markdownDescription: Show a preview window when searching within files

find-it-faster.findWithinFiles.previewCo.markdownDescription: When populated: Used by `fzf` to produce the preview when searching within files. Use `{1}` to indicate the filename, `{2}` for the line number. Example using `cat` and `awk` instead of `bat`: `cat {1} | awk '{if (NR>={2}) print}'`.

find-it-faster.findWithinFiles.previewWi.markdownDescription: When populated: Used by `fzf` to determine position and look of the preview window. See the `fzf` documentation. Example for a horizontal split: `top,50%,border-bottom,+{2}+3/3,~3`.

find-it-faster.findWithinFiles.fuzzRipgr.markdownDescription: By default, matching in "Find Within Files" is exact. Enabling this option relaxes the matching by slightly fuzzing the query that is sent to `rg`: it treats whitespaces as wildcards (`.*`). For example, when enabled, the query `function bar` will match `function foobar`. Otherwise, it won't. This setting does not work on Windows at the moment.

find-it-faster.advanced.useEditorSelecti.markdownDescription: By default, if you have an active editor with a text selection, we'll use that to populate the prompt in `fzf` such that it will start filtering text directly. Uncheck to disable.

find-it-faster.general.restoreFocusTermi.markdownDescription: When enabled, the extension will restore focus to the previously active terminal after executing a command. This is useful if you frequently switch between the terminal and other parts of VS Code. Note: due to limitations in VS Code, will not focus other panel tabs such as problems/output/etc.

find-it-faster.general.useTerminalInEdit.markdownDescription: When enabled, the extension will create the terminal in the main editor stage.

find-it-faster.general.shellPathForTermi.markdownDescription: Set the path for the shell (terminal type) to be used.

find-it-faster.pickFileFromGitStatus.sho.markdownDescription: Show a preview window when picking a file from git status

find-it-faster.pickFileFromGitStatus.pre.markdownDescription: When populated: Used by `fzf` to produce the preview when picking a file from git status. Use `{}` to indicate the filename. Example: `git diff --color=always -- {}`.
When populated: Used by `fzf` to determine position and look of the preview window when picking a file from git status. See the `fzf` documentation. Example: `right:50%:border-left`.

find-it-faster.findTodoFixme.previewEnab.description: Enable preview for TODO/FIXME search results

find-it-faster.findTodoFixme.previewComm.description: Preview command for TODO/FIXME search results

find-it-faster.findTodoFixme.previewWind.description: Preview window configuration for TODO/FIXME search results

find-it-faster.findTodoFixme.searchPatte.description: Regular expression pattern for searching TODO/FIXME/HACK comments. Matches keywords followed by a colon and optional space.

command.description: Command to execute for the custom task

find-it-faster.customTasks.description: Custom tasks that can be executed by the extension

find-it-faster.general.openCommand.description: CLI command to open files. Use 'code' for VS Code, 'cursor' for Cursor, or any other custom command.
